subject: Hook-ups on the 150
author: urkel23@aol.com
full_text:
--part1_4e269.6c3564d4.393b028a_boundary
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="part1_4e269.6c3564d4.393b028a_alt_boundary"


--part1_4e269.6c3564d4.393b028a_alt_boundary
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I'm not keeping any of this a secret, just trying to figure it out before i 
 post or send anything out.  This is the 12-150 radio, it's simple as pie  
now that i did all the grunt work.  
 
Look at the picture, the fourth pin from the right is the AM.  Right  above 
it is the FM (C18).  Notice that i cut the trace going to C18 in the  
picture, easily done with a razor.  I used a jumper wire to connect AM and  FM, 
the FM will not work unless you cut the trace going to it.  The FM VT  puts 
out 11.8 volts and the sweep circuit runs on 9V, that's where the problem  
was.
 
You can figure that out easily with a scope or a multimeter.  This box  
sounds pretty good right now, but the FM sweeps a little out of band.  I  can 
fix that.....but not today.
 
S-H
 
 
 
Steve Hultay
_www.keyportparanormal.com_ (http://www.keyportparanormal.com/) 
_http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/rtsc/_
